title: Kansas attack: father of the injured in a shock - The Hindu
text:
February 24, 2017 13:13 IST Updated: February 24, 2017 13:18 IST more-in Do we really need to go and work in US, says father of Alok Madasani. 
â€œAfter the nightmarish incident, do we really need to go and work in US," is how Madasani Jaganmohan Reddy, father of Alok Madasani, the injured software engineer in Kansas shooting incident reacted on Friday morning. 
"Thank God my son survived the firing but I feel sorry for Srinivas Kuchibhotla, who was close to my son," Mr. Reddy, Chief Engineer in the Rural Water Supply department of Government of Telangana told The Hindu on Friday. 
Narrating his conversation with his injured son, who is now recuperating after the incident, Mr. Reddy said: "My son and Srinivas along with their American friend had visited the Bar. The said assailant started yelling at them that get out of my country. The American friend alerted the Bar owner, who sent away the person, who was reportedly heavily drunk." 
The American is said to have returned with a gun and shot dead Srinivas Kuchibhotla, who was sitting alone. Alok was holding a plate to have his dinner saw the firing and tried to escape. Three rounds were fired at him but two whizzed past him and the third one hit a wall and pierced into his thigh, Mr. Reddy said quoting his elder son Madasani Surender Reddy, who works in Dallas. 
The American friend then rushed and tried to stop the assailant from creating mayhem. In the process, my son's American friend also sustained injuries. 
The RWS official said Alok and Srinivas's American friend Ion Grillot had tried to pacify the assailant identified Adam Purinton that the two Indians were legal immigrants and had all the permission to work in US. 
Shocked by the incident, Mr. Jaganmohan Reddy, who resides in Telephone Colony of Kothapet in the City said his son had obtained his passport in Warangal and hence it was initially believed that they hailed from that City. "The information from my elder son and conversation with Alok says that he is safe. We are shocked by the incident and so are they in US," Mr. Reddy said adding that he was trying to go to US to meet his son. 
" For the last 11 years, I have been booking my tickets for US to visit my two sons but in vain. My work has resulted in the trip getting postponed everytime. But this time I want to rush there to meet my sons," he said adding that he had also spoken to Srinivas Kuchibhotla a couple of times. 
Mr. Reddy said Srinivas's father in law Balakrishna also stayed in Snehapuri Colony close t Kothapet but was not picking up telephone when he had tried to reach him. "I will personally visit their house and express my condolences," Mr. Reddy remarked.
